children.name: New Audio / Visual System for P.S 11
children.description: A new Audio/Visual System in the auditorium of P.S. 11. The school needs a working A/V system to fulfill its curriculum requirements for students.

children.name: Rooftop Greenhouse at P.S. 290
children.description: Construction of a greenhouse as part of the green roof project at PS290. The 800sf greenhouse will provide opportunities to enhance the school's STEAM curricula & create desperately needed play space.

children.name: Computer Carts for 10 Schools
children.description: 32 computers per cart for: P.S. 77, P.S. 198, P.S. 290, P.S./I.S. 217, M. 225, Eleanor Roosevelt, Urban Academy, Vanguard, Manhattan International, and Life Sciences, serving over 5000 students.

children.name: Creation of Library Space at P.S. 191
children.description: Renovate an existing lounge space to create library space to be used by students and their families at P.S. 191.

children.name: Technology Upgrades at LaGuardia High School
children.description: Installation of SMART Boards, laptop carts, desktop computers, and a printing system for a department at LaGuardia High School.

children.name: Science Lab Upgrades
children.description: Upgrade three existing science lab classrooms in Columbia Secondary School to align with NGSS standards that will enhance current STEM curriculum.

children.name: Improve Technology for JHS 54 Booker T. Washington
children.description: Laptop cart for middle school students in J.H.S. 54 Booker T. Washintgon School.

children.name: Air Conditioning for P.S. 369X, P.S. 179X and 352X
children.description: Providing air-conditioning to a school building that has three co-located schools - P.S. 369 Young Leaders Elementary, PS. 179 School International Cultures and X352 D75

children.name: Air Conditioning at P.S. 108
children.description: Air conditioning system for the school cafeteria at P.S. 108 Assemblyman Angelo Del Toro Educational Complex

children.name: District 11 Schools Technology Upgrade
children.description: To provide a technology upgrade for students in the district. $50,000 per school. Includes Laptop carts, smart boards, In-Tech news network program.

children.name: Mobile Laptop Carts and Smart Boards
children.description: Purchase seven carts with thirty laptops each, and ten interactive white boards to be used by students.
children.location: M.S.391, P.S.9, I.S.254, Jonas Bronck Academy

children.name: Jonas Brock Academy Science Cart
children.description: Purchase a mobile science cart with lab materials for the students of Jonas Bronck Academy.

children.name: J.H.S. 194 Auditorium Upgrade
children.description: Project would replace lighting, curtains, sound system, flooring, A/V system and auditorium seating. The auditorium is used for both school and community events.

children.name: P.S. 193 Auditorium Upgrade
children.description: Project would replace lighting, curtains, sound system, flooring, A/V system and auditorium seating. The auditorium is used for both school and community events.

children.name: Bayside High School Music Educational Complex
children.description: Project will fund phase three of state-of-the-art music studio for Bayside High School, which has 350 students in their "Career and Technical Education" music production and performance program.

children.name: P.S. 79 Gymnasium Upgrade
children.description: Project would renovate the school recreational space by replacing wall padding, basketball hoop backboards, sound system, scoreboard and additional gymnasium equipment.

children.name: New Laptops for P.S. 16Q Students
children.description: P.S. 16Q will have new laptops for students to use, expanding the way to educate local students. Local students will learn via interactive lessons on the laptops.

children.name: New Smartboards for P.S. 14Q
children.description: P.S. 14Q will have new smart boards to teach on, expanding the way to educate local students. Local students will learn via interactive lessons on the smart boards.

children.name: Technology Upgrades for Local Schools
children.description: Laptop carts and smart boards at P.S. 33Q, 178Q, I.S. 109Q, Queens High School of Teaching, Business Technology Early College High School, and P224Q at PS 205Q and P.S. /I.S. 266Q.
children.location: Individual Schools are Listed in Description

children.name: New Audio Visual Systems
children.description: New audio visual systems including all necessary technology and auxiliary items.

children.name: Playground Upgrade for P.S. 112
children.description: The play yard needs to be resurfaced and needs equipment such as swings and other items suitable for children in grades K-8. The Kindergarten children have a small play area and only a play tunnel.

children.name: Bathroom Repair
children.description: The bathrooms in P.S. 111 are in dire need of repair, especially the boys' bathrooms. We are requesting that 6 bathrooms. Baccalaureate needs 3 bathrooms upgraded with new stall doors and sinks.

children.name: Special Needs Playground for P4 at Skillman
children.description: Install safety surfacing and customized playground equipment that would target the needs of children with autism spectrum disorders grades K-8. This includes ramps, slides, game boards & monkey bars.

children.name: Adaptive Special Needs Playground Equipment
children.description: This project would install playgrounds with special adaptive equipment for General Education and District 75 students at two locations serving four schools in total

children.name: STEM/ STEAM Mobile Science Carts for Eight Schools
children.description: This project will provide mobile labs to Humanities & Arts HS, Math, Science, Research & Technology HS, Institute for Health Professions HS, PS/IS 116, Pathways College Prep, IS 192, IS 8, and IS 238

children.name: Proper Pupil Potties
children.description: The complete renovation of select bathrooms at three public schools which are a persistent problem. This will reduce the amount of time and money used to maintain the aging bathrooms.

children.name: Operation Restroom Renovation
children.description: Working and updating bathrooms are essential for the health and hygiene of the students. These renovations are to bathrooms which require and have not received recent repairs or renovations.

children.name: Laptop Carts for Classrooms
children.description: Providing laptop carts for schools to make the latest technology more accessible for students in the classroom!

children.name: Smart Boards for Schools
children.description: Fifteen SMART Boards for each of the listed schools will allow for the integration of various technologies within the classroom to improve the learning experiences of students!

children.name: Locker Room Renovations
children.description: Far Rockaway Educational Campus is made up of other schools and is in need of a better locker room. It reminds people of a dungeon. The lighting is terrible and can be dangerous

children.name: Far Rockaway High School Library Upgrade
children.description: The Far Rockaway High School library is very important to the school. It has resources that the students can rely on. But now the library is need of new computers and also an electrical upgrade.

children.name: Classroom Upgrade in P.S. 183Q
children.description: The classrooms are in need of electrical outlets and approximately 35 smart boards in each of the classrooms to help our students further their educations.

children.name: New Weight Room
children.description: The Far Rockaway High School weight room needs new equipment so students do not get injured; it also needs new lockers.

children.name: Upgrades to 5 Schools
children.description: P.S. 47 - Tech equipment ($45,000)  //  P.S. 317 - Tech equipment ($45,000)  //  P.S. 114 - Auditorium upgrades ($75,000)  //  Beach Channel Campus - mobile earth science lab cart RCHS ($60,000)  //  Beach Channel Campus - New exercise room with updated equipment ($150,000)  //  Scholar's Academy - Bathroom updates ($60,000)

children.name: Essential STEM Labs at I.S 318 and P.S 34
children.description: Let's bridge the technology gap and invest in the future for 2,000+ students at two amazing but underserved schools by funding essential STEM (Science, Tech, Engineering & Math) labs at both schools!

children.name: Make Our School Cool! M.S. 126
children.description: Our building serves 3 schools and 1200 kids and needs wiring for AC in the classrooms and Auditorium! It's hard to concentrate and be good students when you're too hot! Give them a chance to succeed!

children.name: Finish the Upgrades with P.S. 261 Computer Carts
children.description: P.S. 261 is a K-5 school with 800 students. Their wiring was upgraded but to utilize the improvements the students need new computers; four new carts will give them what they need!

children.name: Technology Upgrades at P.S. 239 and P.S. 18
children.description: Includes two new laptop carts, two smart tables, a 3-D printers, six smart boards, and forty-two desktops.

children.name: 21st Century Technology at P.S. 120 and P.S. 132
children.description: Includes smart boards, laptops, smart tables, a 3-D Printer, a green wall, and solar & weather panels.

children.name: A Cool Gym at P.S. 257
children.description: An air conditioner in the school gym, which is used throughout the school year and summer programming.

children.name: New Technology for High-Need Schools: PS 375 & 532
children.description: Creating a new computer lab at PS 375 and upgrading ancient AV technology in the auditorium at PS 532 will enable students at these two Title I schools to thrive in the 21st century.

children.name: Renovate Decrepit Bathrooms at PS 9 & PS 316
children.description: Update 6 badly deteriorated bathrooms; includes replacing broken toilets & installing hand dryers.

children.name: Learning Walls for P.S. 20
children.description: Install pin-able writable walls in 20 classrooms for students and teachers to actively co-create learning. 5 temporary walls already increasing learning, initiation, critical thinking and cooperation.
children.location: PS 20 The Clinton Hill School 225 Adelphi Street

children.name: Smartboards for Smart Kids!
children.description: New smartboards for five D36 schools -- PS 289, PS 138, PS 93, PS 243 & Bedford Academy. $64K will fund 8 smartboards per school. Includes required electrical & data.
children.location: PS 289, PS 138, PS 93, PS 243 & Bedford Acdmy

children.name: 4 Science Carts for Bed-Stuy New Beginnings
children.description: Each Science Cart = $62,000

children.name: New Laptops for P.S. 59
children.description: 2 laptop carts w/ 30-35 Lenovo laptops each

children.name: Library Update
children.description: The project would involve the renovation of Middle School 88 and Sunset Park High School's library media center, currently equipped with highly outdated and non-functioning technology.
children.location: M.S. 88 and Sunset Park High School

children.name: South Brooklyn Community H.S.& P.S.169 Upgrades
children.description: There are no lockers, and thus students are required to carry their belongings, books, etc., throughout the day at SBHS. P.S.169 needs renovations of bathrooms that are in a state of disrepair.

children.name: Auditorium Upgrade for M.S. 88 and M.S.136
children.description: These auditoriums are multi-purpose, handicapped-accessible community spaces. The spaces are currently outdated and need upgrades to better serve each school's internal and local community members.

children.name: Retrofit 75 Auditorium Lights for Safety
children.description: School and after-school groups use auditorium daily. Current lights cast shadows, making steep floor unsafe, and use expensive short-life bulbs. New LED retrofit will fix safety and cost issues.

children.name: West Brooklyn Community HS Portable Laptop Lab
children.description: Three mobile carts with 25 laptops each will travel among classrooms to support instruction and foster IT skills. West Brooklyn Community HS is a transfer high school offering a second chance to high-needs students.

children.name: Smartboards for P.S. 92
children.description: Twenty-nine smartboards are needed for PS 92.

children.name: Gymnasium Upgrades at Erasmus High School
children.description: Physical upgrades to the gymnasium

children.name: Computer Lab Updates for Local Schools
children.description: General technology updates at P.S. 249, P.S. 245, P.S. 139, and P.S. 6

children.name: Technology Updates for M.S. 2 Parkside Academy
children.description: Various technological updates at M.S. 2 Parkside Academy

children.name: Beth Jacob UPK Roof Top Jungle
children.description: The roof of this building will be turned into a brand new, innovate playground for all children in the UPK program.

children.name: Technology Upgrades for Midwood High School
Technology in Elementary Schools
children.description: Technology upgrades in P.S. 212, P.S. 216, P.S. 97 and P.S. 188.

children.name: Technology in Middle Schools
children.description: Technology upgrades in I.S. 281, I.S. 228, and I.S. 239.

children.name: Technology in High Schools
children.description: Technology upgrades in Rachel Carson High School, Brooklyn Studio Secondary School, and Kingsborough Early College School.

children.name: Cool Muhlenberg Library. Renovate HVAC System
children.description: Replace the building's HVAC cooling unit to ensure that the branch can continue to serve as a cool space in the summer months, which includes serving as an official NYC Cooling Center.

children.name: 67th Street Library HVAC Improvements
children.description: Replacement or upgrade of the boiler to provide adequate heat.

children.name: Webster Library HVAC Improvements
children.description: Upgrade or replacement of air-conditioning system. This library is a designated NYC cooling center.

children.name: Save Hamilton Grange! Elevator Repair
children.description: Restoration to the exterior of the building and water damage within the building. Replacement of the inoperable boiler, the installation of new windows and a workable HVAC system are needed.

children.name: Mosholu Library HVAC & Roof
children.description: Installation of HVAC system, including unit on roof & compressor, air handling units and ejector pump.

children.name: Spuyten Duyvil Library HVAC System
children.description: Installation of HVAC system, including unit on roof & compressor, air handling units and ejector pump.

children.name: Wall Shelf at Douglaston/Little Neck Library
children.description: Project would install a wall shelf with multiple outlets and chairs for laptop/tablet users for greater efficiency and safety in computer areas of the library.

children.name: New Computers & Tablets at the LeFrak City Library
children.description: New tablets and computers for members of the LeFrak City Library. Tablets will be available to rent for members.

children.name: Technology Upgrade at the Corona Library
children.description: New tablets and computers for members of the Corona Library. Tablets will be available to rent for members with library cards.

children.name: Basement Program Room Upgrade at Astoria Library
children.description: The current program room in Astoria Library is suffering from structural issues (like water damage) which need repair.

children.name: Children's Room Shelves Upgrade at Astoria Library
children.description: Install new shelving units to Astoria Library for children's books.

children.name: Cyber Center Upgrade at Astoria Library
children.description: Upgrade Astoria Library's cyber center for fast and effective internet access anywhere in the library.

children.name: Upgrades at Hollis and Queens Village Libraries
children.description: Facility upgrades, technology installations, and library materials.

children.name: Broadway Library Security System Upgrade
children.description: Installation of security system including CCTV cameras and associated equipment.

children.name: Court Square Library Security System Upgrade
children.description: Installation of security system including CCTV cameras and associated equipment.

children.name: Outdoor Reading Room
children.description: Utilize outdoor space for a reading room and renovate the meeting room in the library. This would add reading space in a natural environment that will encourage returning visits and customer usage.

children.name: Computers, Equipment and Furniture
children.description: Fulfilling a community need by adding more desktop computers along with equipment and furniture to the Ridgewood and Maspeth Public Libraries.

children.name: Rockaway Institute for a Sustainable Environment
children.description: The project with fit out RISE, new community center for local exhibits, film screenings, lectures, public events and youth programs, with furniture and equipment.

children.name: Electrify our Libraries in District 34
children.description: This proposal will provide four electric charging tables at each one of our libraries: Leonard Street, Bushwick Avenue and Dekalb Avenue. Residents will be able to work and re-charge from the same place.

children.name: Upgrade to Activity Rooms
children.description: This proposal will upgrade the activity room in the Leonard Street Library and will include collapsible tables, folding chairs, rugs, freshly painted walls and new book bins.

children.name: Upgrade to Activity Rooms in District 34
children.description: This proposal will include collapsible tables, folding chairs, rugs, freshly painted walls and new book bins for all three district libraries: Leonard Street, Bushwick Avenue and DeKalb Avenue.
